title: Tony Bellew reveals how Ross Barkley helped him acquire the role of 'Pretty' Ricky Conlan in Creed
text:
Sport Tony Bellew reveals how Ross Barkley helped him acquire the role of 'Pretty' Ricky Conlan in Creed The Bomber appeared in the 2015 Rocky film - but initially thought the phone call he received about the role was a wind up Share   Bellew reveals how Ross Barkley helped him land 'CREED' role Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Speaking on ITV's The Nightly Show , Tony Bellew has revealed how Ross Barkley of all people helped him acquire a role in the most recent Rocky film. 
The Bomber played 'Pretty' Ricky Conlan in Creed, the boxer who faces Creed in the film's dramatic showdown at Goodison Park. 
Bellew explains to Nightly Show host John Bishop that when the phone call first came in from a Sylvester Stallone and Warner Brothers representative he thought the whole thing was a joke. Bellew reveals how his acting career started 
"Believe you me I thought it was a wind up," Bellew said. 
"I remember the day perfectly, Everton had just been bounced 6-3 at home to Chelsea. 
"The phone call came in and he said, 'Listen Tony, my name's such and such, I'm calling on behalf of Sylvester Stallone and Warner Brothers and they want to see you to be in the next Rocky movie'. (Photo: Warner Bros) 
"And I just went, 'I don't know what's going on here, pal. But I think you must have the wrong number'. I thought it was a p*** take. 
"He phoned back again and he said, 'I don't think you believe me, do you?'. 
"So I said, 'Listen mate, I'm not really in the mood. I've just watched my team get tanked 6-3, leave it out'. Bellew is a life long Everton fan (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"He phoned me back a third time and I asked where he got my number from. He said Ross Barkley. The phone went down immediately. 
"I phoned Barkley and said, 'If you and the lads are having me on I swear to god your car will be on bricks in the morning'."
